children.name: suitable for a particular situation, job, purpose etc
right b1
children.definition: right suitable.rightis used more in informal language thansuitable:
examples: i don’t know the right word to describe it.
we’ve been thinking about selling the house, but i’m not sure the time is right.
we all agree that carey is the right person for the job.
we’ll tell her when the time is right.
i think you’ve made the right decision.
right for
it’s a good school, but it wasn’t really right for melissa.
it’s a nice house, but it isn’t right for us.
i think she’s definitely theright personfor the job.
a huge development like this isn’t right for such a small village.

children.name: proper b1
children.definition: proper the proper tool, piece of equipment, or way of doing something is the one that most people think is most suitable :
examples: you can’t climb a mountain without the proper equipment.
i can’t make the repairs without the proper tools or materials.
with proper training, most people can learn leadership skills.
you can’t change a wheel without the proper tools.
the proper procedure for hiring staff
properly[adv]
the machine operators had not been properly trained.

children.name: appropriate b2
children.definition: appropriate correct or suitable for a particular time, situation, or purpose - use this especially about something that has been carefully chosen for a particular situation.appropriateis more formal thansuitable::
examples: you will be given your orders at the appropriate time.
considering what he did, i think the punishment was appropriate.
appropriate for
clothes appropriate for a job interview
each member is given a special exercise routine that is appropriate for his or her needs.
appropriate to
an education system which is more appropriate to the needs of the students
it is appropriate (for somebody) to do something
it would not be appropriate for me to discuss that now.
it is appropriate (that)
it seemed somehow appropriate that we should begin our journey here.
appropriate time/place etc
i didn’t feel that this was an appropriate time to mention the subject of money.
highly/entirely/wholly appropriate
i thought his remark was highly appropriate, given the circumstances.
the timing of the announcement wasparticularly appropriate.
where appropriate, i delegate as much work as possible.
mark box 1 or 2,as appropriate.
i can assure you thatappropriate actionwill be taken.
appropriately[adverb] b2
his manner at the funeral was appropriately solemn.
the painters met,appropriately enough, in an art gallery(= used to emphasize that something is very appropriate ).
appropriately dressed

children.name: good a2
children.definition: good  especially spoken very suitable for a purpose or job - use this especially when there are several suitable people or things to choose from:
examples: ▪ bates would be a good person to have on the team.
▪ would now be a good time to discuss the plans for the conference?
good for
▪ the big jars are good for storing rice or pasta.

children.name: suit b2
children.definition: suit sth that suits a person, purpose, situation etc is suitable for them:
examples: this is a job that would suit someone with a lot of experience abroad.
they found us a house close to the campus, which suited us very well.
there are countryside walks tosuit everyone.
we have gifts tosuit every pocket(= of all prices ).
suit something to something
she had the ability to suit her performances to the audience.
suit somebody's needs/requirementsthe building has been adapted to suit the needs of older people.
suit somebody's tasteusers can customize the home page to suit their personal tastes.
suit somebody's purposeit suited her purpose to let him believe the lie.
suit somebody's moodyou can adjust the colour of the lighting to suit your mood.
suit somebody's stylechoose a racket that suits your style of play.
suit the circumstanceswhen writing emails, most people vary the style to suit the circumstances.
suit the occasioni thought a simple black dress would suit the occasion.
suit somebody's pocket(= cost as much as they feel they can pay )the choice is wide, with something to suit everyone's pocket.
suit somebody wellour new house suits us very well.
suit somebody perfectlythe arrangement suited me perfectly.
suit somebody fineinformal: either monday or tuesday would suit me fine for our meeting.
suit somebody down to the groundinformal(= suit someone very well )country life suits you down to the ground.

children.name: suitable b1
children.definition: suitable having the right qualities for a particular person, purpose, or situation: phù hợp
examples: i still haven’t found a suitable job.
you must wear something suitable - preferably black.
we are hoping to find a suitable school.
suitable for
the house is not really suitable for a large family.
suitable place/time etc to do sth
a suitable place to rear young children
suitable to use/be shown etc
these crayons are not suitable to use in very hot weather.
registerin everyday english, people usually say that someone or something isthe rightperson or thing for them, instead of usingsuitable:
we think this isthe rightschool for our child.
very/highly suitable(alsoeminently suitableformal)this exercise is very suitable for back pain sufferers.
particularly/especially suitablethe resort is particularly suitable for families.
equally suitablei wanted a shoe that was equally suitable for both racing and training.
perfectly suitable(= completely suitable )the programme is perfectly suitable for children of all ages.
suitably[adv] b2
few of the young people were dressed suitably for the wedding.

children.name: suited c1
children.definition: be suited to if sb/sth is suited to a situation, purpose, or job they have the qualities that make them suitable for it:
examples: ▪ wearing a suit and tie just is not suited to a tropical climate.
▪ do you think his personality is suited to a career in teaching?
ideally/well/perfectly suited to something
▪ the electric car is well suited to the needs of city drivers.

children.name: be cut out for c2
children.definition: be cut out for if sb is cut out for a particular job, they have personal qualities that are suitable for it and are therefore likely to succeed at it - use this especially in questions and negative sentences: thích hợp với
examples: maybe he’s just not cut out for an acting career.
she knew she was cut out for more than scrubbing floors and doing laundry.

children.name: lends itself to c2
children.definition: lends itself to if sth lends itself to being used in a particular way, it has qualities that make it easy and suitable for using in that way: phù hợp
examples: ▪ many of his poems lend themselves to songs very easily.
▪ the marshy land at the mouth of the neva river hardly lent itself to habitation.

children.name: exactly suitable for a particular situation, job, purpose etc
just right b1
children.definition: just right/ˌdʒʌst ˈraɪt/  exactly suitable:
examples: ▪ i moved into a small apartment close to the college - it was just right.
just right for
▪ your new dress will be just right for the party.
just the right colour/size/age etc
▪ we found a cashmere scarf that was just the right color.
▪ setting the mood for romance means candlelight and just the right music.

children.name: be made for x
children.definition: be made for/biː ˈmeɪd fɔːʳ/  to be exactly right for a particular job or purpose:
examples: được làm cho
▪ the job is made for someone like you.
công việc được thực hiện cho những người như bạn.
▪ in the garden stood an old apple tree with low branches, just made for climbing.
công việc được thực hiện cho những người như bạn.

children.name: fit the bill x
children.partOfSpeech: [verb phrase not in progressive or passive]
children.definition: fit the bill/ˌfɪt ðə ˈbɪl/  to have exactly the qualities needed to be suitable for a particular job, situation etc:
examples: phù hợp với yêu cầu
▪ we know what kind of house we want, but we haven’t yet found one that fits the bill.
chúng ta biết những gì loại nhà chúng ta muốn, nhưng chúng tôi vẫn chưa tìm thấy một phù hợp với yêu cầu.
▪ i need someone who can speak both french and spanish. do you know anyone who fits the bill?
tôi cần một người có thể nói cả tiếng pháp và tiếng tây ban nha. bạn có biết ai phù hợp với hóa đơn không?

children.name: ideal b2
children.definition: ideal/aɪˈdiəl/  the ideal thing or person is the most suitable one you can possibly choose, when there are many to choose from:
examples: lý tưởng
▪ the trip is difficult, even under ideal conditions.
chuyến đi khó khăn, thậm chí trong điều kiện lý tưởng.
▪ if you could complete the report by friday, that would be ideal.
nếu bạn có thể hoàn thành báo cáo vào thứ sáu, đó sẽ lý tưởng.
ideal for
lý tưởng cho
▪ with its tough suspension and 4-wheel drive, the truck is ideal for driving in the desert.
với hệ thống treo cứng và 4 bánh, chiếc xe tải lý tưởng cho việc lái xe trên sa mạc.

children.name: when two things are good when done, eaten etc together
go together b1
children.definition: go together/go withb1  if two things go together, or if one of them goes with the other, they are suitable for each other:
examples: ▪ lamb goes very well with herbs such as rosemary and thyme.
▪ do this skirt and blouse go together?
▪ the company’s old headquarters didn’t go with their corporate image.

children.name: just right with u
children.definition: be just right with if one thing is just right with another, it goes with the other:
examples: ▪ the wine is just right with a grilled steak.
be just the right thing with something
▪ this jacket will be just the right thing with my blue skirt.

children.name: complement x
children.definition: complement if one type of food or drink complements another, it improves the taste because they taste good together: hòa hợp, hài hòa với
examples: ▪ the wine complemented the meal perfectly.
▪ the chicken dish is complemented by wild rice or spiced couscous.

children.name: when two people are suitable for each other
compatible c1
children.definition: compatible able to have a very good relationship with each other, because you have characters, interests, qualities etc that go well together: hợp nhau, tương hợp, “tương thích”
examples: compatible couples generally share the same values and have similar lifestyles and goals.
the success of a relationship depends largely on how compatible two people are and how well they communicate.
registerin everyday english, people often say that two people are(just) right for each other, becausecompatiblesounds rather formal:
on paper they seemed like the perfect couple, but maybe theyjustweren'tright for each other.
compatibility[u]
compatibility is just as important as romantic love.

children.name: well-matched x
children.definition: be well-matchedalsobewell-suitedbritish  if two people are well-matched or well-suited, they are suitable for each other because they agree about most things, like and dislike the same things etc:
examples: ▪ they’re a well-matched pair. he’s ambitious, and she’ll back him all the way.
▪ selina and i are very well-suited to each other. we seem to agree about most things.

children.name: be made for each other x
children.definition: be made for each other if two people are made for each other, they are naturally very suitable for each other :
examples: sam and ellie are made for each other. i just can’t think of either of them with anyone else.
when they met in paris last fall, they fell immediately in love and knew they were made for each other.

children.name: be a perfect match u
children.definition: be a perfect match/pair/couple/biː ə ˌpɜːʳfɪkt ˈmætʃ, ˈpeəʳ, ˈkʌpəl/  to be exactly suitable for each other:
examples: ▪ isn’t it great that will and sue are getting married? i really think they are a perfect match.
▪ they’re a perfect couple - joe has charm and delia has money.

children.name: right for b1
children.definition: be right foralso be the right one/person/man/woman etc for /biː ˈraɪt fɔːʳ, biː ðə ˌraɪt ˈwʌn fɔːʳ/  if someone is right for someone else or the right one for them, they have the type of character, interests etc that make them likely to have a very good relationship with that person:
examples: đúng cho, hợp nhau
▪ she’s a nice girl, but i don’t think she’s right for my brother.
cô ấy là một cô gái tốt, nhưng tôi không nghĩ cô ấy đúng với anh tôi.
▪ as soon as i met him, i knew he was the right one for me.
ngay khi tôi gặp anh ta, tôi biết anh ấy là người phù hợp với tôi.

children.name: ideally suited c1
children.definition: be ideally suited/biː aɪˌdɪəli ˈsuːtd/  british if two people are ideally suited, they are so suitable for each other that it would be very difficult to find a better relationship:
examples: kết hợp lý tưởng
▪ they are both as mad as each other. ideally suited i would say.
cả hai đều điên như nhau. tôi có thể nói rằng phù hợp lý tưởng.
be ideally suited for
kết hợp lý tưởng cho
▪ malcom will be ideally suited for angela. they have such a lot in common.
malcom sẽ phù hợp với angela. họ có rất nhiều điểm chung.

children.name: fit c1
children.definition: fitverb-tt-be suitable
examples: [ t ] to be suitable for something
_with her qualifications, she should fit the job perfectly.
_let the punishment fit the crime.
_i'm sure we'll have something to fit your requirements, madam.
fitadjectivefitter,fittestsuitable
suitable for a particular purpose or activity
_she's not fitforthe level of responsibility she's been given.

children.name: fit in with b2
children.definition: fit inphrasal verb
examples: if one thing fits in with another thing, they look pleasant together or are suitable for each other
_it's a very nice sofa but it doesn't fit inwiththe rest of the room.

children.name: belong b2
children.definition: belongverb
examples: [ i + adverb or preposition] to be in the right or suitable place
_this table belongsinthe sitting-room.
_where do these spoons belong?
_these papers belongwiththe others.

children.name: do c1
children.definition: doverbdid,donebe acceptable
examples: [ i or t ] to be acceptable, suitable or enough (for)
_will this room do or would you prefer one with a shower?
_this kind of behaviour just won't do.
_[ + to infinitive ]itdoesn't dotocriticize your parents.
_i haven't got any grapefruit juice, but i've got some orange juice. will that do (you)?
_"is that enough potato, or would you like some more?" "that'll do (= be enough for) me, thanks."

children.name: fit in c1
children.definition: fit inphrasal verb
examples: to feel that you belong to a particular group and are accepted by them
_it's no surprise she's leaving
-she never really fitted in.

children.name: correct b1
children.definition: correctadjective
examples: taking or showing great care to behave or speak in a way that is generally accepted and approved of
_he's very correctinhis dress/speech/manner, isn't he?

children.name: rightly b2
children.definition: rightlyadverbmorally acceptable
examples: behaving in a way that is suitable and acceptable
_they quite rightly complained to the manager.

children.name: eligible c1
children.definition: eligibleadjective
examples: having the necessary qualities or satisfying the necessary conditions
_are you eligibleforearly retirement/maternity leave?
_you might be eligible for a grant.
_only people over 18 are eligibletovote.

children.name: relevance c1
children.definition: relevancenoun (alsorelevancy)
examples: the degree to which something is related or useful to what is happening or being talkedabout
_what relevance does that point havetothe discussion?
